poem:
**The Sweet Withdrawal**

She counts the days  
like a monk in retreat,  
her lips now savoring  
the unexpected nectar  
of balm, while the ghost  
of cake haunts the kitchen,  
and crumbs lie like relics,  
waiting for sugarless lips  
to return, sanctified,  
to the altar of breakfast.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "66 days to cut down sugar: ‘I find myself enjoying the sweetness of my lip balm’ Not even a year ago, I would have called myself crazy for giving up sugar, even for 66 days. But the truth is I eat way too much of it and it can’t be good for me. I’ve eaten cake for breakfast on more than one occasion and can easily finish a packet of biscuits in a day. I". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
